instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-1700: What is 820-1700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.KERNEL_TASK: What is KERNEL_TASK? KERNEL_TASK is a process that will take up all the CPU and cause the macbook to run very slow when there is a sensor issue. When you see KERNEL_TASK as a process taking up lots of CPU and the machine is working very slow or has loud fans, use a program like hwmonitor to check voltage, amperage, and temperature sensors and look for something that doesnâ€™t look right..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
Hello , Im learning how to fix macbooks and i've been trying to work on one, but as i dont have much knowledge i got stuck. And i was wondering maybe you could guide me atleast where should i start from where i am now. 

I have this macbook which had hot chocolate spilled on. Let me explain what i have discovered and done so far. 
 
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 16" 

Whats wrong with it :

Running slow (Everything you do takes 10x then estimated time)

Has <SIGNAL>KERNEL_TASK</SIGNAL> running 1000+% ( Picture 9 )

When booting to safe mode or to recovery at 3/4 shows artifacts on screen then white screen and back to normal everytime ( Picture 6 ).
Sometimes when turning off shows ( Picture 8 ).

Had weird ssd volume split ( Picture 4 ) not sure what caused that but could not delete weird volumes created like 15 of them same random small size ( Picture 7 ). Was giving errors when trying to delete volumes ( Picture 5 ). But managed to sort that  with forcing through terminal, now looks all ok.


From visual inspection of the board i have found 
Liquid damaged place ( Picture 1 ).
I have cleaned the mess and found that component <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> pins 3 and 4 (Picture 2, 3, 10 ) were burned out 
Also <RESISTOR>R5488</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5441</RESISTOR> had pads missing ( Picture 2, 3, 10). Brought back the pads and found mosfet  (<TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>) to buy so i replaced them. 

As you can see in ( Picture 10 ) <RESISTOR>R5498</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R3003</RESISTOR> marked. They had each pad missing two which i have brought back too and replaced them. 
 
So maybe you could help me from here cause im lost dont know which line to check is it ssd whats slow or cpu not getting right voltage. Or just vsense i dont know. Im just learning this so i tried my best explaining. 

Would be nice if you could help me. ?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Post actual <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> level.
Also run HWMonitor and post screenshot with reported values.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 72008, member: 682"]
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Post actual <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> level.
Also run HWMonitor and post screenshot with reported values.
[/QUOTE]

Hello, thank you for reponse. <SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> at <CAPACITOR>C5489</CAPACITOR> looks 0 on both ends on multimeter, when laptop is on. HWMonitor shows CPU core 8 at 129c so i guess thats were the problem is?
Also when replying could you explicitly explain what info you need cause i am koala its hard for me to understand.
Thank you!!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL> cannot be 0V.
Check resistors and traces around <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>.
Post voltage on all of its pins.

BTW, do not quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
Plugged in with one port and motherboard

<TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>
Pin
1 - 0V
2 - 3.36V
3 - 0.011V
4 - 0V
5 - 0V
6 - 0V

i have replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> with mosfet i've bought because legs 3 and 4 were burned out on old one.
Also <RESISTOR>R3003</RESISTOR> pin 1 has no connection to CB300/400 pin 1 in diode mode not sure if thats ok


clearly somethings wrong, adding pictures
Of current state and view.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
"4 - 0V"
Check the trace to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
XW5480 bridge broken?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message: Sorry for not being able to understand this correctly. Could you explain where is it located or i missunderstand something. Cause i cant see it in same place as on schematics.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message: Just run a wire from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to <SIGNAL>PBUS_S0_VSENSE_IN</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message: Thank you, that's helpful. But just for me not to fail on this part could you just tell me from what component pin to what component pin i just add wire to. As <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> has loads of pins on board

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> has loads of pins on board"
Just choose the easiest point to solder.
You should try to avoid long wire, closest bypass possible.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message: Ok so i just need to get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> wire to any of pins with <SIGNAL>PBUS_S0_VSENSE_IN</SIGNAL> on <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5441</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5481</RESISTOR> any of them. If i understand correctly

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
"<TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5441</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5481</RESISTOR> any of them"
Be sure to have good contact between ALL of them there.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
I added <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> wire now <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> measures :

1 - gnd
2 - 3.3v pulsing down to 0.7 and most of the time comes back to 3.3v
3 - 0V or tiny pulse of ~0.4v sometimes
4 - ~12v  jumping down to 9/7V
5 - 12v jumping down to 7V
6 - 0V most of the time with tiny pulses to 1.17v

tested after wire assembled still same issues also including hwmonitor stats since i forgot last time.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-1700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Running slow, Liquid damage
threads.message:
"4 - ~12v  jumping down to 9/7V"
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is not steady?
How the machine works then?
